poem:
### Thames and the Stars

The murmur of the Thames—  
a filthy whisper,  
carries not stars,  
but the weight of neglect.

Beneath grey skies,  
the river dreams  
in polluted restlessness;  
where water lost its way,  
where stars weep  
unused, tarnished,  
for a cleaner song  
they once knew.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Thames Water ranked worst supplier in England as firms’ ratings hit record low England’s water company ratings have fallen to the lowest level on record after sewage pollution last year hit a new peak, with eight of nine water companies rated as poor and needing improvement by the Environment Agency. The cumulative score of only 19 stars out of a possible 36 is the lowest since the regulator began auditing the companies using the star". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Thames Water ranked worst supplier in England as firms’ ratings hit record low England’s water company ratings have fallen to the lowest level on record after sewage pollution last year hit a new peak, with eight of nine water companies rated as poor and needing improvement by the Environment Agency. The cumulative score of only 19 stars out of a possible 36 is the lowest since the regulator began auditing the companies using the star
